profile.trainingGoal: Lose 20 lbs and build basic strength

limitations: Small apartment, no jumping exercises - neighbors below

injuries: Lower back tightness from desk job
profile.additionalInfo: First time working out consistently. Want something I can stick to.

program.name: Home Strength Foundation: 4-Week Beginner Program
program.description: A comprehensive beginner-friendly strength training program designed for weight loss and foundational strength building using minimal equipment. Perfect for apartment living with no-jump modifications and lower back considerations.

phases.name: Foundation Building Phase
phases.focus: Movement mastery, habit formation, and gradual strength building
phases.explanation: This phase establishes proper movement patterns, builds exercise consistency, and creates a sustainable routine while addressing your lower back tightness through careful exercise selection and progression.
phases.expectations: You'll learn fundamental movement patterns, experience initial strength gains, and develop the habit of consistent morning workouts. Expect some initial muscle soreness that will decrease as your body adapts.
keyPoints: Focus on perfect form over heavy weight
Build the habit of consistent 3x/week training
Address lower back tightness through mobility and strengthening

workouts.name: Workout A - Lower Body Focus
workouts.focus: Lower body strength and core stability

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold dumbbell at chest level
Keep chest up and core engaged
Lower until thighs parallel to floor

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Hip hinge pattern for posterior chain
instructions: Keep dumbbells close to legs
Hinge at hips, slight knee bend
Feel stretch in hamstrings

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.notes: Glute activation and lower back friendly
instructions: Squeeze glutes at top
Keep core engaged
Pause 1 second at top

exercises.name: Modified Plank
instructions: Start on knees if needed
Keep straight line from head to knees/feet
Breathe normally throughout

workouts.name: Workout B - Upper Body Focus
workouts.focus: Upper body strength and postural muscles

exercises.name: Dumbbell Chest Press (Floor)
instructions: Lie on floor, press dumbbells up
Keep core engaged
Lower until elbows touch floor

exercises.name: Bent-Over Row
instructions: Hinge at hips, slight knee bend
Pull dumbbells to lower ribs
Squeeze shoulder blades together

exercises.name: Overhead Press
instructions: Press dumbbells straight up
Keep core tight
Don't arch back excessively

exercises.name: Resistance Band Face Pull
instructions: Pull band to face level
Lead with elbows
Squeeze shoulder blades

workouts.name: Workout C - Full Body Integration
workouts.focus: Movement integration and metabolic conditioning

exercises.name: Dumbbell Thruster
instructions: Squat down, press dumbbells up as you stand
Keep core engaged throughout
Use legs to help drive press

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
instructions: Step back into lunge
Keep front knee over ankle
8 reps each leg

exercises.name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent 90 degrees
Extend opposite arm and leg slowly
6 reps each side

exercises.name: Band Pull-Apart
instructions: Hold band at shoulder height
Pull apart by squeezing shoulder blades
Control the return

mealTiming: Pre-workout: Light protein snack 30-60 min before
Post-workout: Protein within 2 hours
Eat every 3-4 hours to maintain energy
nutrition.notes: Focus on whole foods, adequate protein for muscle building, and a moderate caloric deficit for fat loss. Stay hydrated with 8-10 glasses of water daily.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Focus on learning movements, use lighter weights
Week 2: Increase weight by 2.5-5 lbs for upper body, 5-10 lbs for lower body
Week 3: Add 1-2 reps to each exercise
Week 4: Increase weight again and prepare for more advanced movements

program.name: Foundation Strength & Fat Loss Program
program.description: A beginner-friendly 4-week program designed to build foundational strength, establish consistent exercise habits, and support healthy fat loss. This program uses minimal equipment and low-impact exercises perfect for apartment living, with a focus on proper form and sustainable progression.

phases.name: Foundation Building
phases.focus: Establishing movement patterns, building muscular endurance, and creating sustainable exercise habits
phases.explanation: This phase introduces you to fundamental strength training movements using bodyweight and light resistance. The focus is on learning proper form, building work capacity, and creating a consistent routine you can maintain. By starting with manageable intensity, you'll reduce injury risk while building the foundation for future progress.
phases.expectations: Expect mild muscle soreness in the first 1-2 weeks as your body adapts. You should feel more energized and confident in your movements by week 2. Energy levels may fluctuate initially but will stabilize as your body adjusts to morning training. Focus on quality over quantity - it's okay if exercises feel challenging.
keyPoints: Master proper form before adding resistance
Build the habit of consistent 3x/week training
Listen to your body and respect your lower back
Progress gradually - small improvements compound over time

workouts.name: Full Body Strength A
workouts.focus: Lower body emphasis with foundational movement patterns

activities: Standing quad stretch - 30 seconds each leg
Supine spinal twist - 30 seconds each side

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.notes: Start with 10-15 lb dumbbell. Focus on depth and control.
instructions: Hold dumbbell vertically at chest height, elbows pointing down
Push hips back and down, keeping chest tall and core braced
Lower until thighs are parallel or slightly below, knees tracking over toes
Drive through full foot to stand, squeezing glutes at top

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Use light weight (5-10 lbs each hand). Excellent for lower back and hamstrings when done correctly.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, slight bend in knees, dumbbells in front of thighs
Hinge at hips by pushing them backward, keeping back flat and core engaged
Lower dumbbells along legs until you feel a stretch in hamstrings (mid-shin level)
Squeeze glutes and drive hips forward to return to standing

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.notes: Alternate legs each rep. Use 5-10 lb dumbbells or bodyweight only.
instructions: Stand tall holding dumbbells at sides, feet hip-width apart
Step one foot back and lower until both knees form 90-degree angles
Keep front knee over ankle, torso upright, core tight
Push through front heel to return to standing, then alternate legs

exercises.name: Resistance Band Pull-Apart
exercises.notes: Great for posture and counteracting desk work. Use light resistance.
instructions: Hold band at shoulder height with arms extended, palms down
Pull band apart by squeezing shoulder blades together
Keep arms straight and shoulders down away from ears
Control the return to starting position, maintaining tension

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.notes: Excellent core exercise that's gentle on the lower back. Move slowly and controlled.
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended toward ceiling, knees bent at 90 degrees
Press lower back firmly into mat and engage core
Slowly extend opposite arm and leg toward floor without arching back
Return to start and alternate sides, maintaining back contact with mat

workouts.name: Full Body Strength B
workouts.focus: Upper body emphasis with pushing and pulling movements

activities: Thread the needle stretch - 5 each side
Doorway chest stretch - 30 seconds each side
Cross-body shoulder stretch - 30 seconds each arm

exercises.name: Incline Push-Up
exercises.notes: Use a sturdy chair, couch, or counter. Lower the surface as you get stronger.
instructions: Place hands on elevated surface slightly wider than shoulder-width
Body forms straight line from head to heels, core engaged
Lower chest toward surface by bending elbows at 45-degree angle
Push back up to full arm extension, squeezing chest at top

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
exercises.notes: Use 10-15 lb dumbbell. Support yourself on a sturdy surface. Great for back strength.
instructions: Hinge forward at hips, one hand on sturdy surface for support
Let dumbbell hang directly below shoulder, arm extended
Pull dumbbell toward hip by driving elbow back, squeezing shoulder blade
Lower with control, keeping core braced and back flat throughout

exercises.name: Resistance Band Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Stand on band with feet hip-width apart. Control the movement in both directions.
instructions: Stand on band, hold handles at shoulder height with palms forward
Brace core and avoid arching lower back
Press hands overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower with control back to shoulder height, maintaining tension

exercises.name: Dumbbell Curl
exercises.notes: Use 5-10 lb dumbbells. Keep elbows pinned to sides throughout.
instructions: Stand tall with dumbbells at sides, palms facing forward
Curl weights toward shoulders by bending elbows only
Squeeze biceps at top, keeping upper arms stationary
Lower with control, fully extending arms at bottom

exercises.name: Tricep Dip on Chair
exercises.notes: Use a sturdy chair. Keep hips close to chair and go only as deep as comfortable.
instructions: Sit on edge of sturdy chair, hands gripping edge beside hips
Slide hips off chair, supporting weight with arms, legs extended or bent
Lower body by bending elbows to 90 degrees, keeping elbows close to body
Press through palms to straighten arms and return to start

exercises.name: Forearm Plank
exercises.notes: Quality over time. Increase by 5 seconds each week as able.
instructions: Rest on forearms and toes, elbows directly under shoulders
Create straight line from head to heels, engage core fully
Squeeze glutes, keep hips level - don't let them sag or pike up
Breathe steadily throughout, maintaining tension

workouts.name: Full Body Strength C
workouts.focus: Balanced full body with core stability emphasis

activities: March in place with arm swings - 60 seconds
Hip circles - 10 each direction each leg
Kneeling hip flexor stretch - 30 seconds each side
Supine spinal twist - 30 seconds each side

exercises.name: Sumo Squat
exercises.notes: Wide stance targets inner thighs and glutes. Use 10-20 lb dumbbell.
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed out 45 degrees
Hold one dumbbell vertically with both hands in front of body
Lower by pushing hips back and bending knees, keeping chest tall
Drive through heels to stand, squeezing glutes and inner thighs at top

exercises.name: Step-Up
exercises.notes: Use a sturdy step or bottom stair. Hold light dumbbells for added challenge.
instructions: Stand facing step, one foot planted fully on step surface
Drive through top foot to step up, bringing other foot to meet it
Step back down with control, leading with the same leg
Complete all reps on one side, then switch legs

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.notes: Add a dumbbell on hips for resistance. Excellent for glutes and lower back health.
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat and hip-width apart, dumbbell on hips
Press lower back into mat, then drive through heels to lift hips
Squeeze glutes hard at top, creating straight line from shoulders to knees
Lower with control, briefly touching floor before next rep

exercises.name: Floor Chest Press
exercises.notes: Use 10-15 lb dumbbells. Floor limits range of motion which is easier on shoulders.
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent, feet flat, dumbbells pressed above chest
Lower weights with control until upper arms touch floor
Press dumbbells back up, squeezing chest at top
Keep wrists stacked over elbows throughout movement

exercises.name: Resistance Band Face Pull
exercises.notes: Anchor band at face height on door. Excellent for shoulder health and posture.
instructions: Secure band at face height, grip ends with palms facing down
Step back to create tension, arms extended in front
Pull band toward face, separating hands and squeezing shoulder blades
Rotate hands so thumbs point back at end position, control the return

exercises.name: Bird Dog
exercises.notes: Move slowly and controlled. Excellent for core stability and lower back.
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips
Brace core and extend opposite arm and leg until parallel with floor
Keep hips and shoulders level, avoid rotation or arching
Return to start with control, then switch to opposite arm and leg

mealTiming: Light snack 30-45 minutes before morning workout (banana, small toast with nut butter)
Balanced breakfast within 1 hour after workout with protein and carbs
Eat protein with every meal to support muscle building and satiety
Stay hydrated - aim for 8-10 glasses of water daily
nutrition.notes: This moderate calorie deficit supports 0.5-1 lb fat loss per week while fueling your workouts. Prioritize protein (aim for 0.8-1g per pound of bodyweight) to preserve muscle during weight loss. Focus on whole foods: lean proteins, vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and healthy fats. Don't skip meals - consistent eating supports energy for morning workouts and prevents overeating later.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Focus on learning proper form. Use lighter weights or bodyweight only. It's okay to rest longer if needed.
Week 2: Aim to complete all prescribed reps with good form. Begin finding your appropriate weight for each exercise.
Week 3: Increase dumbbell weights by 2.5-5 lbs on exercises that feel comfortable, or add 1-2 reps per set.
Week 4: Push intensity slightly (RPE 7-8). Add 5 seconds to planks. Complete workout with minimal rest adjustments.

profile.trainingGoal: Build muscle mass, especially upper body. Currently stuck at bench 185 for reps.
injuries: Right shoulder impingement - no behind neck press
profile.additionalInfo: Been training 2 years, want to break through plateaus.

program.name: Upper Body Mass & Strength Breakthrough Program
program.description: An 8-week intermediate program designed to break through plateaus and build significant upper body mass while maintaining lower body strength. Combines strength training with hypertrophy work using efficient supersets.

phases.name: Foundation & Volume Phase
phases.focus: Building training capacity and muscle endurance while establishing strength base
phases.explanation: This phase establishes a solid foundation with higher volume training to increase work capacity and create the muscle damage necessary for hypertrophy. We'll use moderate weights with higher rep ranges to build muscle endurance and prepare for the intensive phase.
phases.expectations: Expect muscle soreness initially as volume increases. Energy levels may dip in week 2-3 before adaptation occurs. You should notice improved muscle pumps and endurance by week 4.
keyPoints: Focus on perfect form with controlled tempo
Prioritize upper body volume while maintaining lower body
Use supersets to maximize time efficiency

workouts.name: Upper Power
workouts.focus: Heavy compound movements for strength foundation

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.notes: Main chest builder - focus on breaking plateau
instructions: Retract shoulder blades and maintain arch
Lower bar to chest with control
Drive through heels while pressing

exercises.name: Barbell Rows
instructions: Hinge at hips, maintain neutral spine
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen
Squeeze shoulder blades at top

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Avoid behind-neck position due to shoulder impingement
instructions: Start with bar at shoulder height
Press straight up, not forward
Keep core tight throughout movement

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-ups
instructions: Full dead hang start position
Pull chest to bar, not just chin over
Control the descent

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree angle
Lower dumbbells to chest level
Press up and slightly together

exercises.name: Cable Rows
instructions: Keep chest up and shoulders back
Pull handle to lower chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together

exercises.name: Barbell Curls
instructions: Keep elbows at sides
Control the negative portion
Avoid swinging or momentum

exercises.name: Close Grip Bench Press
instructions: Hands about shoulder-width apart
Keep elbows tucked to sides
Focus on tricep contraction

workouts.name: Lower Body Power
workouts.focus: Lower body strength and power development

exercises.name: Back Squats
instructions: Bar on upper traps, feet shoulder-width
Sit back and down, knees track over toes
Drive through heels to stand

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
instructions: Start with bar at hip level
Push hips back, slight knee bend
Lower bar to mid-shin, feel hamstring stretch

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
instructions: Rear foot elevated on bench
Lower into lunge, front knee tracks over toe
Drive through front heel to return

exercises.name: Leg Curls
instructions: Adjust pad to back of ankles
Curl heels to glutes smoothly
Control the return to start

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Step forward into deep lunge
Keep torso upright, front knee over ankle
Push off front foot to next step

exercises.name: Calf Raises

Hold peak contraction briefly
Lower slowly to stretch calves

exercises.name: Plank
instructions: Maintain straight line from head to heels
Keep hips level, don't sag
Breathe normally throughout hold

workouts.name: Push Focus

exercises.name: Incline Barbell Press

Lower bar to upper chest
Press straight up, not backward

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Start with dumbbells at shoulder level
Press up and slightly together

exercises.name: Dips

Lower until shoulders below elbows

exercises.name: Cable Lateral Raises

Raise arm to shoulder height

exercises.name: Chest Flyes

Feel stretch in chest at bottom

exercises.name: Overhead Tricep Extension

exercises.name: Front Raises

Raise to shoulder height

exercises.name: Diamond Push-ups

exercises.name: Deadlifts

Drive through heels, chest up
Hips and knees extend together

exercises.name: Pull-ups

exercises.name: T-Bar Rows

Pull handles to lower chest

exercises.name: Face Pulls

Squeeze rear delts

exercises.name: Lat Pulldowns

Pull bar to upper chest

exercises.name: Hammer Curls

exercises.name: Cable Curls

exercises.name: Shrugs

Keep torso upright
Sit straight down

exercises.name: Stiff Leg Deadlifts

Push hips back

exercises.name: Leg Press

Lower to 90 degrees

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.notes: 10 per leg, superset with leg press
instructions: Step into deep lunge

exercises.name: Leg Curls

mealTiming: Pre-workout: 1-2 hours before training
Post-workout: Within 30 minutes
Spread protein across 4-5 meals
nutrition.notes: Moderate calorie surplus to support muscle growth. Focus on whole foods and adequate protein timing around workouts.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Learn movement patterns, establish baselines
Week 2: Add weight when hitting top rep range
Week 3-4: Focus on progressive overload, increase weight 2.5-5lbs when possible

phases.name: Intensity & Strength Phase
phases.focus: Heavy strength work with strategic volume to break through plateaus
phases.explanation: This phase shifts focus to heavier loads and lower rep ranges to build maximum strength while maintaining muscle mass. We'll target your bench press plateau specifically while continuing to build overall upper body mass through strategic volume work.
phases.expectations: Expect to handle heavier weights and see strength gains. Recovery may take longer due to intensity. You should break through your bench press plateau and see significant strength increases across all lifts.
keyPoints: Focus on breaking through bench press plateau
Use heavier loads with longer rest periods
Maintain muscle mass with strategic accessory work

instructions: Use competition grip width

Pull chest to bar

progressionProtocol: Week 1-2: Establish new 3-5 rep maxes
Week 3: Peak intensity - attempt PR loads
Week 4: Deload with 80% volume, maintain intensity

program.name: Upper Body Hypertrophy Breakthrough
program.description: An 8-week progressive overload program designed to break through your bench press plateau and build significant upper body muscle mass. Combines strength protocols with hypertrophy techniques using strategic supersets for time efficiency while respecting your shoulder limitation.

phases.name: Foundation & Volume Accumulation
phases.focus: Building work capacity and addressing weak points through strategic volume
phases.explanation: This phase establishes a solid foundation by increasing training volume progressively while identifying and strengthening weak links in your pressing chain. We'll use moderate weights with higher rep ranges to build muscle tissue and improve work capacity, setting the stage for heavier lifting in phase 2.
phases.expectations: Expect muscle soreness in weeks 1-2 as your body adapts to increased volume. Your bench press may not increase immediately, but you'll notice improved muscle fullness and endurance. Energy levels should stabilize by week 3.
keyPoints: Focus on mind-muscle connection and perfect form
Progressive volume increase each week
Strategic superset pairings for efficiency and recovery
Building pressing endurance and weak point identification

workouts.name: Upper Body Push A
workouts.focus: Horizontal pressing emphasis with chest and tricep development

activities: 5 minutes light rowing or arm circles
Empty bar bench press 2x10 with pause
Doorway chest stretch 30 seconds each side
Overhead tricep stretch 30 seconds each arm

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Plateau buster focus - pause 1 second at chest each rep
instructions: Retract shoulder blades and arch upper back slightly, feet flat on floor
Lower bar to lower chest with elbows at 45-degree angle, not flared
Drive through feet and press bar in slight arc back toward face

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
exercises.notes: 30-degree incline, focus on upper chest stretch
instructions: Set bench to 30-degree angle, dumbbells at shoulder level
Lower with control feeling deep stretch in upper chest
Press up and slightly together without clanking dumbbells

exercises.name: Dumbbell Flyes
instructions: Maintain slight bend in elbows throughout movement
Lower until deep stretch is felt, arms roughly parallel to floor
Squeeze chest at top without letting dumbbells touch

exercises.name: Tricep Rope Pushdowns
instructions: Keep elbows pinned to sides throughout movement
Spread rope apart at bottom and squeeze triceps hard
Control the negative for 2 seconds on each rep

exercises.name: Overhead Dumbbell Tricep Extension
instructions: Hold single dumbbell overhead with both hands cupping the top plate
Lower behind head keeping upper arms stationary and close to ears
Extend fully and squeeze triceps at top

exercises.name: Lateral Raises
exercises.notes: Light weight, high quality reps for shoulder health
instructions: Lead with pinkies slightly higher than thumbs
Raise to shoulder height only, no higher
Control descent for 2 seconds, no swinging

workouts.name: Lower Body A
workouts.focus: Quad-dominant with glute and hamstring accessory work

activities: Leg swings front and back 10 each leg
Hip flexor stretch 30 seconds each side

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat
exercises.notes: High bar position, focus on depth and control
instructions: Bar on upper traps, feet shoulder width, toes slightly out
Break at hips and knees simultaneously, keep chest up
Descend until hip crease below knee, drive through full foot

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Focus on hamstring stretch at bottom
instructions: Start standing with bar at hips, slight knee bend maintained throughout
Push hips back while lowering bar along thighs
Stop when you feel strong hamstring stretch, squeeze glutes to return

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Take long stride forward, front shin vertical at bottom
Back knee hovers just above ground
Drive through front heel to step forward into next rep

exercises.name: Leg Curl Machine
instructions: Adjust pad to sit just above ankles
Curl with control, squeeze hamstrings at top for 1 second
Lower slowly for 3-count negative

exercises.name: Leg Extension Machine
instructions: Adjust backrest so knees align with machine pivot point
Extend fully and squeeze quads hard at top for 2 seconds
Lower with control, dont let weight stack crash

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises
exercises.notes: Full stretch at bottom, pause at top
instructions: Position balls of feet on platform, heels hanging off
Lower heels until maximum stretch is felt
Rise onto toes as high as possible, pause 2 seconds at top

mealTiming: Breakfast: High protein within 1 hour of waking

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Learn the program, establish baseline weights at RPE 7
Week 2: Increase weight 5 lbs on compounds if form is solid, same weight on isolation
Week 3: Add 1 rep to each set where possible before adding weight
Week 4: Test new working weights, aim for 5-10 lb increases on main lifts

phases.name: Strength & Intensity Amplification
phases.focus: Lower rep strength work with intensity techniques to break plateaus
phases.explanation: Building on the volume base from phase 1, we now shift to heavier loading with lower rep ranges. This phase uses proven plateau-breaking techniques including pause reps, tempo manipulation, and strategic back-off sets. The goal is to translate the muscle built in phase 1 into maximal strength output.
phases.expectations: Expect to feel stronger by week 2. The lower volume but higher intensity will feel different - less pump, more neural fatigue. Your bench press should start moving again. Some workouts will feel heavy; trust the process.
keyPoints: Heavier weights with lower rep ranges
Pause reps and tempo work for plateau busting
Maintained volume on accessory work for muscle retention
Strategic deload in final week before testing

program.name: 83kg Powerlifting Meet Prep - 12 Week Peak
program.description: A periodized 12-week powerlifting meet preparation program designed to peak your squat, bench press, and deadlift for competition. This program progresses from an accumulation phase building work capacity, through an intensification phase increasing intensity, culminating in a peaking and taper phase to express maximal strength on meet day.

phases.name: Accumulation Phase
phases.focus: Building work capacity, refining technique, and establishing baseline strength through moderate intensity volume work
phases.explanation: This phase builds the foundation for your peak by accumulating quality training volume at submaximal intensities. The higher rep ranges and moderate loads will reinforce proper motor patterns, address weak points through targeted accessory work, and build the work capacity needed to handle the heavier intensities coming in later phases. RPE stays controlled at 7-8 to ensure quality reps and avoid early fatigue accumulation.
phases.expectations: Expect moderate fatigue accumulation throughout this phase. You should feel challenged but recovered enough to hit all prescribed work. Focus on bar speed and technical precision rather than grinding reps. Weight on the bar will feel manageable - this is intentional. Trust the process as we build toward heavier work.
keyPoints: Focus on technical proficiency and bar speed at submaximal weights
Build work capacity through higher volume sets
Address weak points: lockout work for bench/deadlift, off-the-floor strength for deadlift
Maintain bodyweight within 83kg class while supporting recovery

exercises.name: Paused Squat
exercises.notes: 2-second pause in the hole. Builds strength out of bottom position.
instructions: Descend under control to competition depth
Hold completely still for 2 full seconds - no bouncing or sinking
Drive explosively out of the pause maintaining torso position

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Builds posterior chain and addresses off-the-floor weakness.
instructions: Hinge at hips pushing them back, slight knee bend

Squeeze glutes hard at top, full hip extension

instructions: Control the eccentric for 2-3 seconds
Drive through full foot, avoid knee cave
Stop just short of lockout to maintain tension

instructions: Control the weight throughout full range of motion
Squeeze hard at peak contraction for 1 second

Gradual warmup sets to working weight
Doorway pec stretch 30 seconds each side

exercises.name: Competition Bench Press
alternatives: Close grip bench if shoulder issues
exercises.notes: Full competition setup with pause. Practice commands mentally.
instructions: Set up with strong arch, retracted scapulae, feet firmly planted
Lower bar to touch point with control, pause motionless on chest
Drive through legs, press in slight arc back toward face

exercises.name: Close Grip Bench Press
exercises.notes: Addresses lockout weakness by emphasizing triceps.
instructions: Grip shoulder width or slightly narrower
Keep elbows tucked at roughly 45 degrees
Focus on driving through triceps at lockout

exercises.name: Barbell Row
exercises.notes: Builds upper back thickness for bench stability.
instructions: Hinge to roughly 45 degrees, maintain flat back
Pull to lower chest/upper abdomen
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top, control descent

exercises.name: Dumbbell Incline Press
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
Press dumbbells up and slightly together
Lower with control, feeling stretch at bottom

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdown
exercises.notes: Direct tricep work for lockout strength.
instructions: Keep elbows pinned at sides throughout movement
Fully extend at bottom, squeeze triceps hard
Control the weight back up, no swinging

exercises.name: Face Pull
exercises.notes: Rear delt and external rotator health for shoulder balance.
instructions: Pull rope to face level, splitting hands to ears
Externally rotate at end position, pinkies back
Control the return, maintain tension throughout

workouts.name: Lower - Deadlift Focus
workouts.focus: Competition deadlift development with off-the-floor accessories

activities: Gradual warmup sets to working weight

exercises.name: Competition Deadlift
exercises.notes: Use competition stance and setup. Reset each rep from dead stop.
instructions: Set up with shins touching bar, hips set, lats engaged
Push floor away, keep bar tight to body throughout
Lock out with glutes, stand tall without hyperextending

exercises.name: Deficit Deadlift
exercises.notes: 1-2 inch deficit. Specifically addresses off-the-floor weakness.
instructions: Stand on plate or low platform, 1-2 inches
Maintain same setup as competition pull
Focus on leg drive off floor, patience off the ground

exercises.name: Front Squat
exercises.notes: Builds quad strength for deadlift initiation and squat depth.
instructions: Clean grip or cross-arm grip, elbows high
Descend with upright torso, sit between hips
Drive up maintaining elbow position, no forward lean

exercises.name: Good Morning
exercises.notes: Posterior chain strength using safety squat bar if available.
instructions: Bar in squat position, slight knee bend
Hinge forward pushing hips back until torso near parallel
Drive hips forward to stand, squeeze glutes at top

exercises.name: Ab Wheel Rollout
exercises.notes: Core stability for maintaining neutral spine under load.
instructions: Start kneeling, wheel under shoulders
Roll out extending hips and shoulders together
Pull back using abs, not hip flexors, maintain hollow position

workouts.name: Upper - Volume
workouts.focus: Upper body hypertrophy and weak point development

activities: 5 minutes arm circles and light band work

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Builds shoulder strength supporting bench press.
instructions: Start with bar at collarbone, grip just outside shoulders
Brace core, press bar straight up clearing face
Lock out overhead with bar over midfoot, biceps by ears

exercises.name: Weighted Dips
exercises.notes: Tricep and chest development for lockout strength.
instructions: Lean slightly forward for chest emphasis, upright for triceps
Lower until upper arm parallel or just below
Press up powerfully, fully extending elbows at top

exercises.name: Pull-ups
exercises.notes: Lat development for bench stability and deadlift lockout.
instructions: Grip shoulder width or slightly wider
Pull elbows down and back, drive chest to bar
Lower with control, full extension at bottom

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Additional chest volume with greater range of motion.
instructions: Setup similar to barbell bench, strong arch and retraction
Lower dumbbells with control to deep stretch
Press up and slightly together, squeeze chest at top

exercises.name: Hammer Curl
exercises.notes: Bicep and brachialis development for arm balance.
instructions: Keep elbows pinned at sides, neutral grip
Curl weight up without swinging body
Control the descent, full extension at bottom

exercises.name: Lateral Raise
exercises.notes: Shoulder cap development and joint health.
instructions: Slight bend in elbows, lead with pinkies slightly
Raise to shoulder height, no higher
Control descent, maintain tension throughout

mealTiming: Pre-workout meal 2-3 hours before: 40-50g protein, 60-80g carbs, moderate fat
Intra-workout: Water or electrolytes if session exceeds 90 minutes
Post-workout within 2 hours: 40-50g protein, 50-70g carbs
Evenly distribute protein across 4-5 meals throughout day
nutrition.notes: Maintain bodyweight around 81-82kg to allow for water and food weight on meet day while staying in 83kg class. Slight caloric surplus supports training recovery. Prioritize protein timing around workouts and quality carbs from whole grains, fruits, and vegetables.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Establish working weights at RPE 7, focus on technique refinement
Week 2: Same weights, should feel slightly easier as fatigue adapts - RPE 7
Week 3: Add 2.5-5% to main lifts, accessories stay same - RPE 7-8
Week 4: Same as week 3, may feel accumulated fatigue - RPE 8, deload week coming

phases.name: Intensification Phase
phases.focus: Increasing intensity while managing volume, building toward competition attempts
phases.explanation: This phase transitions from volume accumulation to intensity development. Working weights increase while total rep volume decreases, allowing your body to adapt to heavier loads. Competition lift specificity increases with more practice at competition standards. Accessory work becomes more targeted toward identified weak points. This phase builds the absolute strength that will be displayed on meet day.
phases.expectations: Weights will feel heavier and more challenging. Some fatigue from the accumulation phase may linger in week 5 but should clear by week 6. Focus shifts from bar speed to grinding through heavy weights while maintaining technique. You should feel progressively stronger as the phase continues.
keyPoints: Increase intensity on main lifts to 80-90% range
Reduce volume to allow recovery from heavier loads
Increase competition specificity - practice pauses and commands
Continue addressing lockout and off-the-floor weaknesses with targeted accessories

workouts.name: Lower - Squat Focus
workouts.focus: Heavy squat singles and doubles with competition specificity

activities: Extensive warmup sets to working weight
Foam roll quads and glutes if needed

exercises.name: Competition Squat
alternatives: High bar squat if low bar causes issues
exercises.notes: Heavy triples working toward competition weight. Full competition setup and mental commands.
instructions: Practice full competition commands mentally: squat, rack
Maintain consistent walkout and setup routine
Each rep should be identical in depth and execution

exercises.name: Squat with Chains
exercises.notes: Accommodating resistance builds lockout strength and rate of force development.
instructions: Hang chains so they deload at bottom, full weight at top
Accelerate hard through entire range of motion
Focus on driving through sticking point aggressively

exercises.name: Pause Squat
exercises.notes: 3-second pause builds starting strength and confidence in the hole.
instructions: Descend to competition depth, hold 3 full seconds
Stay tight during pause - no relaxing or sinking
Explode out of hole maintaining torso angle

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.notes: Single leg work for balance and hip stability.
instructions: Rear foot elevated on bench, front foot forward enough for vertical shin at bottom
Lower until rear knee nearly touches ground
Drive through front heel, squeeze glute at top

exercises.name: Leg Extension
exercises.notes: Quad isolation for knee health and leg drive strength.
instructions: Extend fully, squeeze quad hard at top for 1 second
Control descent, dont let weight drop
Keep back against pad throughout

workouts.name: Upper - Bench Focus
workouts.focus: Heavy bench press work with competition specificity and lockout emphasis

activities: 5 minutes arm circles and band work

exercises.name: Competition Bench Press
alternatives: Touch and go if shoulder issues with pause
exercises.notes: Heavy triples with full competition pause. Practice commands mentally.
instructions: Consistent setup routine - same every rep
Pause motionless until you would receive press command
Drive with leg drive, press in slight arc back

exercises.name: Bench Press with Chains
exercises.notes: Accommodating resistance specifically targets lockout weakness.
instructions: Chains should deload at chest, full weight at lockout
Accelerate through entire press
Focus on driving hard through triceps at top

exercises.name: Two-Board Press
exercises.notes: Overloads lockout position directly. Use spotter to hold boards.
instructions: Touch boards on chest, pause briefly
Press explosively, focus on tricep lockout
Can handle heavier weight than full range

exercises.name: Chest Supported Row
exercises.notes: Upper back thickness without lower back fatigue from heavy squats and deads.
instructions: Chest flat on pad, arms hanging straight down
Pull elbows back, squeeze shoulder blades together
Control descent, full stretch at bottom

exercises.name: JM Press
exercises.notes: Tricep-specific pressing movement for lockout development.
instructions: Lower bar toward throat/upper chest with elbows flared
Bar path is between skull crusher and close grip bench
Press back up focusing on tricep contraction

exercises.name: Rear Delt Fly
exercises.notes: Rear delt health and shoulder balance.
instructions: Slight bend in elbows, chest on incline bench
Raise arms to sides squeezing rear delts
Control descent, maintain constant tension

workouts.name: Lower - Deadlift Focus
workouts.focus: Heavy deadlift work with competition specificity and off-the-floor emphasis

activities: Lower back decompression - hang from bar

exercises.name: Competition Deadlift
exercises.notes: Heavy doubles with competition setup. Reset completely between reps.
instructions: Consistent setup routine for every single rep
Full reset between reps - no touch and go
Each rep should look identical

exercises.name: Deficit Deadlift
instructions: Maintain identical setup to competition pull
Be patient off the floor - dont jerk
Focus on pushing floor away, leg drive initiation

exercises.name: Block Pull
exercises.notes: 2-3 inch blocks. Allows heavier loading for lockout confidence.
instructions: Set blocks so bar starts at or just below knee
Pull with same form as competition lift
Focus on driving hips through aggressively at lockout

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.notes: Quad development without spinal loading after heavy deadlifts.
instructions: Feet shoulder width, mid-platform
Lower with control until knees approach 90 degrees
Press through full foot, dont lock out completely

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raise
exercises.notes: Core strength for maintaining bracing under heavy loads.
instructions: Hang from bar, slight arm bend
Raise legs by curling pelvis up, not just hip flexion
Control descent, no swinging

workouts.name: Upper - Volume and Weak Points
workouts.focus: Moderate intensity pressing with emphasis on triceps and lockout development

exercises.name: Close Grip Bench Press
exercises.notes: Primary pressing movement focused on tricep development.
instructions: Grip shoulder width or thumbs length from smooth
Keep elbows at 45 degrees or slightly tucked
Focus on tricep lockout, full extension

exercises.name: Incline Barbell Press
exercises.notes: Upper chest and front delt development.
instructions: Moderate incline, 30-45 degrees
Lower to upper chest with control
Press up and slightly back, lockout over shoulders

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-ups
exercises.notes: Heavy lat work for deadlift lockout and bench stability.
instructions: Add weight via belt or dumbbell between feet
Pull to chest, full range of motion
Control descent, dead hang at bottom

exercises.name: Dips
instructions: Upright torso for tricep emphasis
Lower until shoulders below elbows
Press up powerfully, full lockout

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdown
exercises.notes: Direct tricep isolation for lockout strength.
instructions: Elbows pinned at sides throughout
Full extension at bottom, hard squeeze
Control return, dont let weight stack crash

exercises.name: Face Pull
exercises.notes: Shoulder health and rear delt development.
instructions: High anchor point, pull to face
Externally rotate at end, pull rope apart
Control return, constant tension

mealTiming: Pre-workout meal 2-3 hours before: 40-50g protein, 50-70g carbs
Post-workout: 40-50g protein, 40-60g carbs within 2 hours
Before bed: Casein protein or cottage cheese for overnight recovery
Stay hydrated - minimum 3-4 liters water daily
nutrition.notes: Slight reduction in total calories as training volume decreases. Maintain protein high to support recovery from heavier intensities. Begin monitoring morning bodyweight more closely - aim to hover around 81-82kg. Reduce sodium slightly in final week if running heavy. Quality sleep becomes increasingly important - aim for 8+ hours.

progressionProtocol: Week 5: Reduce volume from Phase 1, increase intensity to 80-85% - RPE 8
Week 6: Continue intensity increase, 82-87% on main lifts - RPE 8-9
Week 7: Peak intensity week, hit 87-92% singles and doubles - RPE 9
Week 8: Slight backoff, 80-85% with reduced volume - preparing for peak phase

phases.name: Peaking and Taper Phase
phases.focus: Realizing competition strength through reduced volume, maintained intensity, and strategic rest
phases.explanation: This final phase peaks your strength for meet day. Volume drops dramatically while intensity stays high to maintain neural adaptations. The taper in the final week allows accumulated fatigue to dissipate while keeping the nervous system primed. Opener attempts are established and practiced. Meet day logistics and commands are rehearsed. Your body transforms training strength into competition strength.
phases.expectations: You may feel detrained in the final week - this is normal and expected. Trust the taper. Weights in weeks 9-11 should move well, feeling stronger than any point in training. Final week you do minimal work. On meet day, you should feel explosive, fresh, and ready to hit PRs. Any lingering fatigue should fully clear.
keyPoints: Establish and practice opener attempts - should be smooth and confident
Reduce volume dramatically while maintaining intensity
Final week is minimal work - trust the taper
Practice meet day routine including warmup timing and commands
Peak bodyweight management - come in at or just under 83kg

workouts.name: Squat Opener Practice
workouts.focus: Establish and practice competition squat opener

activities: Dynamic mobility for hips and ankles
Progressive warmup sets replicating meet warmup timing

exercises.name: Competition Squat - Opener
exercises.notes: This should be your planned third attempt from 12 weeks ago or ~90% of current max. Should move smoothly.
instructions: Full competition setup and commands
Execute exactly as you will on meet day
This weight should feel controlled and confident

exercises.name: Competition Squat - Backoff
exercises.notes: Volume work at moderate intensity to maintain strength without fatigue.
instructions: Same competition setup
Focus on speed and technical precision
Should feel relatively easy

exercises.name: Light Romanian Deadlift
exercises.notes: Light posterior chain work - maintain movement patterns without fatigue.
instructions: Use moderate weight - this is not for building, just maintaining
Focus on stretch and contraction
Keep it light and controlled

exercises.name: Leg Curl
instructions: Light weight, focus on blood flow
Full range of motion
No need to push intensity

workouts.name: Bench Opener Practice
workouts.focus: Establish and practice competition bench press opener

activities: Band pull-aparts and rotator cuff work
Progressive warmup sets with competition pause
Practice commands at each warmup weight

exercises.name: Competition Bench Press - Opener
exercises.notes: Planned opener around 90% of current max. Must have full competition pause. Should be smooth.
instructions: Full competition setup with commands
Complete pause on chest until press command
This weight should feel strong and controlled

exercises.name: Competition Bench Press - Backoff
exercises.notes: Maintain pressing strength without accumulating fatigue.
instructions: Competition pause on each rep
Focus on bar path and leg drive
Should move well

exercises.name: Light Dumbbell Row
exercises.notes: Light upper back work to maintain stability.
instructions: Moderate weight, controlled movement
Focus on squeeze at top
Keep it light

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdown
instructions: Light weight, high reps for blood flow
Full extension each rep
Dont push to failure

workouts.name: Deadlift Opener Practice
workouts.focus: Establish and practice competition deadlift opener

activities: Hip hinge patterning with light loads
Practice setup routine at each weight

exercises.name: Competition Deadlift - Opener
exercises.notes: Planned opener around 90% of current max. Should feel solid and fast.
instructions: Full competition setup and commands
Identical routine to meet day
Should break floor smoothly and lock out with authority

exercises.name: Competition Deadlift - Backoff
exercises.notes: Maintain pulling strength and pattern. Reset fully between reps.
instructions: Full reset between reps
Competition setup each rep
Should feel controlled

exercises.name: Light Good Morning
instructions: Light weight only
Maintain movement pattern
No fatigue accumulation

exercises.name: Plank
instructions: Standard plank position
Brace like preparing for heavy lift
Breathe normally throughout

workouts.name: Light Movement - Meet Week Prep
workouts.focus: Keep nervous system activated without fatigue - final week minimal work

activities: Empty bar work on all three lifts

exercises.name: Squat - Activation
exercises.notes: Keep the motor pattern fresh. No fatigue whatsoever.
instructions: Light weight, perfect technique
Practice commands mentally
Should feel effortless

exercises.name: Bench Press - Activation
exercises.notes: Keep pressing pattern fresh. Full pause on each rep.
instructions: Light weight, competition pause
Focus on setup routine
Effortless execution

exercises.name: Deadlift - Activation
exercises.notes: Single light pulls to maintain pattern. Full reset.
instructions: Light weight, perfect setup
Practice your routine
Should feel like nothing

exercises.name: Band Pull-Apart
instructions: Light band, controlled movement
Keep shoulders healthy
No fatigue

mealTiming: Continue normal meal timing through week 11
Week 12 (meet week): Slightly increase carbs for glycogen loading
Day before meet: Familiar foods only, nothing new
Meet day: Light breakfast 3-4 hours before, easily digestible carbs and protein
nutrition.notes: Final weight management is critical. Weigh daily and adjust as needed to come in at 82-83kg. If running close to limit, slight water and sodium manipulation may help - reduce sodium slightly 2 days out, then normalize day before. Avoid drastic cuts - you need energy to perform. Night before: carb-focused meal, familiar foods. Morning of: light, easily digestible breakfast you have practiced.

progressionProtocol: Week 9: Practice openers on all lifts, should be 90% and smooth - establish exact weights
Week 10: Hit openers again, possibly conservative 2nd attempts if feeling exceptional
Week 11: Light singles at opener weight early week, rest of week very light or off
Week 12 (Meet Week): Monday light activation if needed, then rest until meet. Trust your preparation.

profile.trainingGoal: Maintain bone density, improve balance, stay independent
preferences: No floor exercises - hard to get up
profile.additionalInfo: Doctor cleared me for exercise. Want to stay active for grandkids.

program.name: Active Aging Strength & Balance Program
program.description: A comprehensive 4-week beginner program designed specifically for mature women focusing on bone density maintenance, balance improvement, and functional strength. Emphasizes safe, joint-friendly exercises that support independence and daily activities.

phases.name: Foundation Building
phases.focus: Building fundamental strength patterns, improving balance, and establishing safe movement habits
phases.explanation: This phase introduces basic strength training movements using machines and light weights to build confidence and establish proper form. Focus is on weight-bearing exercises that stimulate bone density while respecting joint limitations.
phases.expectations: Initial muscle soreness in first 1-2 weeks is normal. Improved energy and balance should be noticeable by week 3. Better stability when playing with grandchildren by week 4.
keyPoints: Start with lighter weights to perfect form
Focus on controlled movements for joint health
Build confidence with supported exercises

workouts.name: Strength & Stability A
workouts.focus: Lower body strength and core stability

activities: 5 minutes stationary bike or treadmill walking

exercises.name: Leg Press Machine
exercises.notes: Primary lower body movement for bone density
instructions: Keep knees aligned over toes
Lower slowly to comfortable depth
Press through heels to return

exercises.name: Seated Row Machine
instructions: Sit tall with chest out
Pull elbows back and squeeze shoulder blades
Control the return slowly

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raises
instructions: Rise up on toes slowly
Hold for 1 second at top
Lower with control

exercises.name: Stability Ball Wall Squats
instructions: Keep ball between back and wall
Squat down slowly to comfortable depth
Stand up with control

exercises.name: Seated Bicep Curls
instructions: Sit with back supported
Curl weights up slowly
Lower with control

exercises.name: Standing Balance Challenge
instructions: Stand on one foot near wall for safety
Hold for 15-30 seconds each foot
Progress to eyes closed when comfortable

workouts.name: Upper Body & Mobility
workouts.focus: Upper body strength and flexibility

activities: 5 minutes arm bike or light walking

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine
instructions: Adjust seat for proper alignment
Press out slowly and controlled
Bring arms back with control

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown Machine
instructions: Lean slightly back
Pull bar to upper chest
Control the weight up slowly

exercises.name: Shoulder Press Machine
instructions: Keep core engaged
Press up in controlled motion
Lower slowly to start position

exercises.name: Assisted Step-Ups
instructions: Use handrail for support
Step up with full foot contact
Step down with control

exercises.name: Tricep Extensions (Seated)
instructions: Support back against chair
Keep elbows stable
Extend arms slowly and controlled

exercises.name: Seated Spinal Rotation
instructions: Sit tall in chair
Rotate gently to each side
Hold for 2-3 seconds

workouts.name: Functional Movement
workouts.focus: Balance, coordination, and functional strength

exercises.name: Smith Machine Squats
instructions: Position bar comfortably on shoulders
Squat to comfortable depth
Drive through heels to stand

exercises.name: Cable Row (Standing)
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Pull cable to lower ribs
Squeeze shoulder blades together

exercises.name: TRX Assisted Squats
instructions: Hold TRX handles for support
Squat back and down
Use arms to assist standing

exercises.name: Standing Hip Abduction
instructions: Loop band around ankles
Lift leg out to side slowly
Control return to center

exercises.name: Seated Lateral Raises
instructions: Sit with back supported
Raise arms out to sides
Lower slowly with control

exercises.name: Standing Heel-to-Toe Walk
instructions: Walk in straight line near wall
Place heel directly in front of toe
Take 10 steps forward and back

workouts.name: Total Body & Recovery
workouts.focus: Light strength work and flexibility

exercises.name: Leg Press (Light)
instructions: Use lighter weight than Day 1
Focus on smooth movement
Full range of motion

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
instructions: Sit with good posture
Pull with smooth rhythm
Focus on form over weight

exercises.name: Standing Weight Shifts
instructions: Shift weight from foot to foot
Lift non-weight bearing foot slightly
Hold for 2 seconds each side

exercises.name: Wall Push-Ups
instructions: Stand arm's length from wall
Push away and return slowly
Keep body straight

exercises.name: Light Dumbbell Curls
instructions: Use very light weight
Focus on smooth movement
Full range of motion

exercises.name: Seated Full Body Stretch
instructions: Hold each stretch 30-45 seconds
Breathe deeply during stretches
Never force any movement

mealTiming: Eat light snack 1-2 hours before exercise
Post-workout: protein within 2 hours
Focus on calcium-rich foods for bone health
nutrition.notes: Emphasize lean proteins, colorful vegetables, whole grains, and calcium-rich dairy. Stay hydrated throughout the day. Include vitamin D sources to support bone health and calcium absorption.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Focus on learning movements and proper form
Week 2: Maintain form while slightly increasing effort
Week 3: Add small weight increases where comfortable
Week 4: Build confidence for continued progression

program.name: Active Grandma Strength & Balance Program
program.description: A safe, progressive strength training program designed for maintaining bone density, improving balance, and supporting independence. This program uses machine-based and supported exercises appropriate for someone with knee arthritis and a hip replacement history, while building functional strength for daily activities with grandchildren.

phases.name: Foundation & Functional Strength
phases.focus: Building baseline strength, improving balance confidence, and establishing safe movement patterns
phases.explanation: This foundational phase focuses on machine-based exercises that provide stability and support while building strength in key areas for bone health and daily function. All exercises are performed standing or seated on equipment - no floor work required. The emphasis is on controlled movements, proper breathing, and gradual progression to build confidence and physical capacity safely.
phases.expectations: Expect mild muscle soreness in the first 1-2 weeks as your body adapts. You should feel more stable and confident in your movements by week 2. Energy levels may improve, and you'll likely notice everyday tasks becoming easier. The weight-bearing exercises will help stimulate bone density maintenance. Listen to your body - some joint stiffness is normal, but sharp pain is not.
keyPoints: All exercises are standing or seated - no floor work required
Machine-based movements provide stability and support for arthritic knees
Focus on controlled tempo to protect joints and maximize bone-building benefit
Swimming can be added on rest days for additional cardio and joint relief

workouts.name: Full Body Strength A
workouts.focus: Lower body emphasis with upper body support work

activities: 5 minutes recumbent bike at easy pace to warm joints
Seated leg swings holding chair arms - 10 each leg
Standing hip circles holding stable surface - 5 each direction
Arm circles progressing small to large - 10 each direction
Gentle torso rotations with hands on hips - 10 total
Seated hamstring stretch using towel - 30 seconds each leg
Standing quad stretch holding wall - 30 seconds each leg
Seated spinal twist - 30 seconds each side
Deep breathing: 5 breaths with arms raising overhead

exercises.name: Leg Press Machine
exercises.notes: Start light - focus on full range of motion without knee discomfort
instructions: Position feet hip-width apart on platform, toes slightly turned out
Press through whole foot, not just toes - imagine pushing the floor away
Control the return slowly - take 3 seconds to lower the weight
Stop before knees lock out at the top

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine
exercises.notes: Excellent for upper body bone density - adjust seat height so handles align with mid-chest
instructions: Sit with back flat against pad, feet firmly on floor
Grip handles with wrists straight, not bent back
Press forward while exhaling, keep shoulders down away from ears
Return slowly with control - don't let the weight stack crash

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.notes: Important for posture and back strength - sit tall throughout
instructions: Sit with slight knee bend, chest lifted and proud
Pull handles toward lower ribs, squeezing shoulder blades together
Keep elbows close to body - imagine putting them in your back pockets
Return with control, feeling a stretch in upper back

exercises.name: Leg Curl Machine
exercises.notes: Strengthens hamstrings which support knee stability
instructions: Adjust pad to sit just above heel on lower calf
Curl heels toward buttocks in smooth controlled motion
Squeeze at the top for one second
Lower slowly - control is more important than weight

exercises.name: Leg Extension Machine
exercises.notes: Use light weight - this exercise can stress arthritic knees if too heavy
instructions: Sit with back against pad, grip handles for stability
Extend legs slowly - do not snap or jerk to straight
Stop just before full lockout to protect knee joint
Lower even slower than you lifted - 3-4 seconds down

exercises.name: Seated Overhead Press Machine
alternatives: Seated dumbbell press with light weights
exercises.notes: Great for shoulder strength and overhead reaching ability
instructions: Sit with lower back supported, feet flat on floor
Press handles up and slightly together overhead
Keep core gently engaged - don't arch lower back excessively
Lower with control until upper arms are parallel to floor

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise Machine
alternatives: Seated calf raise with dumbbell on thigh
exercises.notes: Important for ankle stability and walking confidence
instructions: Stand with balls of feet on platform, heels hanging off
Rise up onto toes as high as comfortable
Hold at top for one second, feeling calf muscles contract
Lower heels below platform level for full stretch

workouts.name: Balance & Upper Body Focus
workouts.focus: Upper body strength with dedicated balance training

activities: 5 minutes walking on treadmill at comfortable pace - use handrails as needed
Shoulder rolls forward and backward - 10 each
Standing march in place holding stable surface - 20 steps
Gentle neck tilts side to side - 5 each
Upper back stretch hugging yourself - 30 seconds
Standing side bend stretch - 20 seconds each side
Seated deep breathing with eyes closed - 1 minute

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown Machine
exercises.notes: Builds back strength for posture and pulling movements
instructions: Sit with thighs secured under pads, grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
Pull bar down toward upper chest, leading with elbows
Squeeze shoulder blades down and together at bottom
Return slowly with control - feel the stretch at top

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Bicep Curl
exercises.notes: Functional arm strength for lifting grandchildren and groceries
instructions: Sit tall on bench with back supported, dumbbells at sides
Curl weights up rotating palms toward shoulders
Keep upper arms still - only forearms move
Lower slowly and completely before next rep

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdown Cable
exercises.notes: Important for pushing movements and getting up from chairs
instructions: Stand close to cable machine, elbows pinned to sides
Push handle down until arms are straight
Squeeze triceps at bottom for one second
Return with control - don't let weight pull arms up fast

exercises.name: TRX Assisted Balance Reach
exercises.notes: Holding TRX provides safety while challenging balance
instructions: Hold TRX handles with light grip for safety backup
Stand on one leg, other foot slightly off ground
Reach free leg forward, side, and back while staying balanced
Use TRX only as needed - goal is independent balance

exercises.name: Stability Ball Wall Squat Hold
exercises.notes: Ball provides back support while building leg endurance
instructions: Place ball between lower back and wall
Walk feet forward about 12 inches from wall
Lower into squat position with thighs parallel or above
Hold position breathing normally - ball rolls with you

exercises.name: Seated Resistance Band External Rotation
exercises.notes: Protects shoulder health and improves posture
instructions: Sit with elbow bent 90 degrees, pinned to side with towel
Hold band anchored at belly level
Rotate forearm outward keeping elbow still
Return slowly - rotator cuff muscles need time under tension

exercises.name: Standing Hip Abduction with Band
exercises.notes: Critical for hip stability and walking confidence - extra attention to left hip
instructions: Stand holding wall or sturdy surface, band around ankles
Lift right leg out to side keeping hips level and facing forward
Control the return - don't let band snap leg back
Keep standing leg slightly soft, not locked

workouts.name: Full Body Strength B
workouts.focus: Posterior chain and core stability emphasis

activities: 5 minutes recumbent bike gradually increasing pace
Hip hinge practice with hands on thighs - 10 reps
Ankle circles each direction - 10 each foot
Figure-4 stretch seated on bench - 30 seconds each side
Standing calf stretch against wall - 30 seconds each
Seated forward fold reaching toward feet - 30 seconds

exercises.name: Cable Pull-Through
exercises.notes: Safe way to train hip hinge pattern without loading spine - great for glutes
instructions: Face away from cable, rope attachment between legs
Hinge at hips pushing buttocks back, slight knee bend
Drive hips forward to stand tall, squeezing glutes
Keep arms relaxed - power comes from hips, not arms

exercises.name: Seated Chest Supported Row Machine
alternatives: Chest supported dumbbell row on incline bench
exercises.notes: Chest pad supports spine while building back strength
instructions: Adjust chest pad height so arms can fully extend
Pull handles toward lower ribs, elbows close to body
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end of pull
Return with slow control feeling back muscles stretch

exercises.name: Smith Machine Assisted Squat
exercises.notes: Smith machine bar provides stability - feet slightly forward is fine
instructions: Position bar across upper back on muscle, not neck bone
Feet shoulder width, slightly in front of bar line
Sit back and down keeping chest up proud
Depth based on comfort - stop before knee pain

exercises.name: Hip Abduction Machine
exercises.notes: Strengthens outer hip muscles crucial after hip replacement
instructions: Sit with back against pad, outer thighs against pads
Press legs outward in controlled motion
Hold open position for one second squeezing outer hips
Return slowly - don't let machine slam closed

exercises.name: Hip Adduction Machine
exercises.notes: Inner thigh strength supports knee stability
instructions: Sit with inner thighs against pads, start in open position
Squeeze legs together in controlled motion
Hold squeezed position for one second
Open slowly with control against the resistance

exercises.name: Standing Cable Core Rotation
exercises.notes: Trains core rotation important for daily activities - no floor work needed
instructions: Stand sideways to cable, handle at chest height, arms extended
Rotate torso away from machine keeping arms straight
Move from core, not arms - imagine belly button leading
Return with control, don't let cable yank you back

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Lateral Raise
exercises.notes: Use very light weights - shoulder muscles fatigue quickly
instructions: Sit tall with dumbbells at sides, slight elbow bend
Raise arms out to sides until parallel with floor
Lead with elbows, not hands - like pouring water from pitchers
Lower slowly - control is more important than weight

workouts.name: Strength & Mobility Integration
workouts.focus: Full body strength with extended flexibility work

activities: 5 minutes walking or recumbent bike easy pace
Standing hip circles holding support - 8 each direction each leg
Shoulder IYTW movements with no weight - 5 each position
March in place with high knees if comfortable - 20 steps
Seated piriformis stretch - 45 seconds each side
Standing quadricep stretch holding wall - 45 seconds each
Upper trap stretch tilting head - 30 seconds each side
Cat-cow standing with hands on thighs - 10 cycles
Deep breathing seated with eyes closed - 90 seconds

exercises.name: Leg Press Machine
exercises.notes: Slight increase from Day 1 if feeling strong - listen to knees
instructions: Position feet hip-width on platform, toes slightly out
Push through entire foot evenly
Control descent taking 3 full seconds
Stop before complete knee lockout at top

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine
exercises.notes: Focus on mind-muscle connection with chest
instructions: Back flat against pad, feet firmly grounded
Press forward exhaling, imagine hugging a large tree
Keep shoulders pulled down, not shrugged up
Slow return letting chest muscles stretch

exercises.name: TRX Row
exercises.notes: Adjust body angle - more upright is easier, more horizontal is harder
instructions: Grip handles, walk feet forward to create angle
Keep body straight like a plank from head to heels
Pull chest toward handles, elbows back
Lower with control maintaining rigid body position

exercises.name: Seated Leg Curl Machine
exercises.notes: Hamstring strength protects knees during walking
instructions: Adjust machine so pad sits above heel on calf
Curl heels under seat smoothly
Squeeze hamstrings at bottom position
Straighten legs slowly with full control

exercises.name: Resistance Band Face Pull
exercises.notes: Excellent for posture - pulls shoulders back and down
instructions: Anchor band at face height, grip with both hands
Pull toward face separating hands, elbows high and wide
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end position
Return slowly keeping tension in band throughout

exercises.name: Stability Ball Seated Marching
exercises.notes: Challenges core stability and balance in safe seated position
instructions: Sit tall on stability ball near wall for safety
Feet flat on floor, hands on hips or holding wall lightly
Alternate lifting feet 2-3 inches off floor slowly
Keep hips level - ball should not rock side to side

exercises.name: Standing Dumbbell Curl to Press
exercises.notes: Functional combination movement - like lifting grandchild to shoulder
instructions: Stand holding light dumbbells at sides near wall for balance
Curl weights to shoulders
Rotate palms forward and press overhead
Reverse the entire sequence with control

mealTiming: Breakfast within 1-2 hours of waking to support energy
Small snack with protein 1-2 hours before workout
Post-workout snack within 45 minutes including protein
Largest meal at lunch when digestion is strongest
Light dinner 3+ hours before bed for better sleep
nutrition.notes: Protein is critical for maintaining muscle mass and supporting bone health at 67. Aim for 25-30g protein at each meal from sources like eggs, fish, chicken, Greek yogurt, cottage cheese, and legumes. Calcium and Vitamin D are essential - consider fortified foods or supplements if not getting enough from diet. Stay well hydrated - aim for 6-8 glasses of water daily, more on workout days. Collagen supplements may support joint health but discuss with your doctor. Limit processed foods and added sugars which can increase inflammation and worsen arthritis symptoms.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Learn all movements with conservative weight - RPE 4-5. Focus entirely on proper form and breathing. Rest longer between sets if needed.
Week 2: Maintain same weights while improving movement quality. Begin to feel more confident with exercises. Add 1-2 reps if feeling strong.
Week 3: Small weight increases (2.5-5 lbs on machines) where form remains excellent. Should feel challenged but controlled at RPE 5-6.
Week 4: Consolidate gains - aim to complete all prescribed reps with good form. Note which exercises feel strongest for future progression.

profile.trainingGoal: Improve endurance for hiking and maintain strength. Training for Mt. Rainier climb.
profile.additionalInfo: Travel frequently for work. Need exercises I can do in hotel gyms too.

program.name: Mt. Rainier Summit Training Program
program.description: An 8-week hybrid training program designed to build the endurance, strength, and resilience needed for high-altitude mountaineering. Combines progressive strength training with cardio conditioning while accommodating frequent travel.

phases.name: Base Building Phase
phases.focus: Establish aerobic base and movement foundation
phases.explanation: This phase builds your cardiovascular base while establishing proper movement patterns for strength exercises. Focus is on building work capacity and preparing your body for more intense training.
phases.expectations: You'll feel more energized during daily activities and notice improved recovery between workouts. Initial muscle soreness is normal as your body adapts.
keyPoints: Build aerobic efficiency
Master movement patterns
Develop training consistency

workouts.name: Lower Body Strength
workouts.focus: Leg strength and stability for steep terrain

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat
instructions: Keep chest up and core braced
Descend to parallel or below
Drive through heels to stand

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Hinge at hips, not knees
Keep bar close to legs
Feel stretch in hamstrings

exercises.name: Walking Lunges with Dumbbells
instructions: Step forward with control
Lower back knee toward ground
Push off front leg to next step

exercises.name: Calf Raises
instructions: Rise up on toes slowly
Pause at top
Control the descent

exercises.name: Plank Hold
instructions: Maintain straight line from head to heels
Engage core and glutes
Breathe normally throughout

workouts.name: Cardio Endurance
workouts.focus: Aerobic base building and hiking simulation

exercises.name: Stair Climber
instructions: Maintain steady rhythm
Use handrails minimally
Focus on breathing pattern

exercises.name: Rowing Machine
instructions: Drive with legs first
Pull handle to ribs
Control the return phase

workouts.name: Upper Body Strength
workouts.focus: Back and shoulder strength for pack carrying

exercises.name: Bent-Over Barbell Row
instructions: Hinge at hips with straight back
Pull bar to lower ribs
Squeeze shoulder blades together

exercises.name: Overhead Press
instructions: Press straight up
Keep core tight
Full lockout at top

exercises.name: Pull-ups or Assisted Pull-ups
instructions: Full hang at bottom
Pull chest to bar
Control the descent

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Start at shoulder height
Press up and slightly forward
Control the weight down

exercises.name: Face Pulls
instructions: Pull rope to face level
Separate handles at face
Squeeze shoulder blades

workouts.name: Outdoor Adventure
workouts.focus: Real-world hiking practice and enjoyment

exercises.name: Trail Hiking
instructions: Maintain steady breathing
Practice efficient movement
Focus on foot placement

mealTiming: Pre-workout: Light snack 1-2 hours before
Post-workout: Protein within 30 minutes
Hydration: 2-3 liters daily
nutrition.notes: Focus on building sustainable eating habits while supporting training adaptations. Emphasize whole foods and adequate hydration.

progressionProtocol: Week 1-2: Learn exercises, establish base fitness
Week 3-4: Increase weights by 5-10% and extend cardio duration

phases.name: Peak Conditioning Phase
phases.focus: Mountaineering-specific strength and endurance
phases.explanation: This phase intensifies training with weighted exercises and longer cardio sessions to simulate the demands of climbing Mt. Rainier with a heavy pack at altitude.
phases.expectations: You'll build significant strength endurance and mental toughness. Training becomes more challenging but directly applicable to your climbing goals.
keyPoints: Simulate mountain conditions
Build strength endurance
Develop mental resilience

workouts.name: Loaded Strength Training
workouts.focus: Heavy pack simulation and power development

exercises.name: Weighted Vest Squats
instructions: Vest should be 15-20% body weight
Maintain proper squat form
Focus on explosive upward movement

exercises.name: Barbell Deadlift
instructions: Set up with bar over mid-foot
Drive through heels
Keep bar close to body

exercises.name: Weighted Step-ups
instructions: Use 18-20 inch platform
Drive through heel of lead leg
Control the descent

exercises.name: Farmer's Walks
instructions: Keep shoulders back
Maintain tight core
Walk with purpose

exercises.name: Russian Twists with Weight
instructions: Lean back slightly
Rotate from core, not arms
Touch weight to each side

workouts.name: Endurance Challenge
workouts.focus: Extended cardio with pack weight simulation

exercises.name: Weighted Vest Stair Climbing
instructions: Start with 10-15% body weight
Maintain steady rhythm
Practice mountain breathing

exercises.name: Rowing Intervals
instructions: Pull hard for 3 minutes
Recovery pace between sets
Focus on powerful strokes

exercises.name: Weighted Vest Walking
instructions: Easy conversational pace
Focus on posture
Practice efficient movement

workouts.name: Power and Stability
workouts.focus: Explosive movements and balance for technical terrain

exercises.name: Barbell Thrusters
instructions: Squat then press overhead in one motion
Keep core engaged throughout
Full hip extension at top

exercises.name: Single-Leg Deadlift
instructions: Hinge at hip while lifting leg
Keep back straight
Feel stretch in standing leg hamstring

exercises.name: Box Step-ups with Knee Drive
instructions: Drive knee up explosively
Full hip extension at top
Control the descent

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-ups or Lat Pulldowns
instructions: Add weight if doing 8+ bodyweight pull-ups
Full range of motion
Control both phases

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
instructions: Support opposite hand on bench
Pull dumbbell to hip
Squeeze shoulder blade

workouts.name: Mountain Simulation
workouts.focus: Long duration hiking with elevation and pack weight

exercises.name: Weighted Pack Hiking
instructions: Pack weight 20-30% of body weight
Include elevation gain/loss
Practice nutrition and hydration

mealTiming: Pre-workout: Substantial meal 2-3 hours before long sessions
During workout: Sports drinks for sessions >60 min
Post-workout: Recovery meal within 45 minutes
Hydration: 3+ liters daily
nutrition.notes: Increased calories to support intense training. Practice mountain nutrition strategies during long sessions. Focus on foods you'll eat on the mountain.

progressionProtocol: Week 1-2: Increase intensity and weight loads
Week 3-4: Peak training loads, practice mountain nutrition and gear
